programme.title: My Pet My Angel
programme.desc: After leaving her boyfriend, veterinary surgeon Kam Wai-ting (Lam Ha Mei) moves to Sai Kung with her beloved dog Donut and starts a new life. At her new workplace, Wai-ting meets animal communicator Wong Sing-yan (Chow Ka Lok). The duo often quarrel due to their different values regarding pets. In an accident, Sing-yan acquires skills for communicating with Donut, and a man and a dog gradually build a friendship and help each other. Sing-yan learns from Donut that Wai-ting has some love issues, so he helps her decipher her conundrum. The duo's relationship improves, and they gradually like each other. However, they do not have feelings of affection due to their age difference. Donut wants to play matchmaker for the duo, but it gets into hilarious situations. And its ideas even backfire. Each of the duo also has their own admirers, resulting in more obstacles in their relationship.

programme.title: A Perfect Man
programme.desc: Yeung Yat-cheng (Joe Ma) has a good reputation in the realm of personal security. He is invited by his buddy Ha Chung-chau (Tsui Wing) to join a security company that is tasked with protecting a tycoon called Tseung Ding-tin (KK Cheung). While starting his new job, Yat-cheung is faced with personnel issues. Meanwhile, due to his unhappy childhood, Yat-cheng does not believe in marriage. However, he happens to hook up with Yau Chi-ching (Ali Lee). And Chi-ching then even starts working for the security company. Yat-cheng gradually has affectionate feelings for her. But the couple's relationship has to overcome certain hurdles. Moreover, problems keep cropping up as Ding-tin's son Cheuk-ting and his buddy Miu Shing-lam (Ricco Ng) secretly return to Hong Kong. Shing-lam even keeps picking on Yat-cheng. While Yat-cheng and Chi-ching's relationship gradually improves, Yat-cheng suspects Chi-ching has some ulterior motive as he somehow discovers her secret. The couple's relationship is on the verge of breaking up.

Yasmin hanya ketawakan sahaja impian tunangnya itu kerana menganggap impian Nasir hanyalah sebuah angan-angan. Pada suatu hari, Nasir kemalangan dan meninggal dunia tanpa sempat menyiapkan novel karangannya. Selepas kematian Nasir, Yasmin berusaha menyiapkan novel tersebut demi sebuah cinta.

Tanpa disedari, Yati menyimpan perasaan cinta kepada Yazid. Pada suatu hari, kelab golf tempat mereka bekerja dikunjungi oleh seorang Dato' Mustafa bersama anaknya, Nor. Yazid mendapat peluang untuk bermain golf yang dimiliki oleh Dato Mustafa di Kuala Lumpur dan dia berjaya membawa kejayaan kepada kelab itu. The failed medical reform plan had not in any way frustrated Yat-to, who puts forward Comprehensive Opening Up of the Drug Formulary Bill with the aim of providing low-cost medications to rare disease patients. However, oncologist Ip Ching (Nancy Wu) objects to his proposal, and she even goes against Yat-to as she is appointed as MarsPax CE. Meanwhile, former W.M.U. member Lee Man-shun (Moses Chan) joins the MarsPax team and collaborates with A&E Dr Zoe So (Natalie Tong), neurosurgeon Lui Oi-ling (Kelly Cheung) and other white knights in handling all kinds of critical situations.

programme.title: Exorcist's 2nd Meter, The

He is also reunited with the mature soul of his buddy Mok Wai-ho (Hubert Wu). He even encounters Sze Loi-sze (Gloria Tang) and his younger brother Sze Lo-sze, who are both exorcists. However, some demonic curse has caused Ma Kwai to keep thinking of a doctor by the name of Chong Tsz-yeuk (Mandy Wong). Tsz-yeuk then hooks up with genie Wind Lion god (C Kwan), eventually reviving certain memory of limbo in her subconscious. Pui Pui-na (Moon Lau) has died because of Ma Kwai. She then transforms into a phantom to keep him company. But Pui-na just cannot leave everything behind as she is too sentimental about the mortal realm. A child abuse case triggers off the comeback of demonic power. Wai-ho has actually been controlled by mysterious demonic power.

programme.desc: With CE Yeung Yat-to (Kwok Chun On) and Deputy CE Tong Ming (Kenneth Ma) at the helm of the leading public health institution Marshall Paxton Hospital, core departments, namely neurosurgery, CTS and A&E, are writing life-saving medical stories. The failed medical reform plan had not in any way frustrated Yat-to, who puts forward Comprehensive Opening Up of the Drug Formulary Bill with the aim of providing low-cost medications to rare disease patients. However, oncologist Ip Ching (Nancy Wu) objects to his proposal, and she even goes against Yat-to as she is appointed as MarsPax CE. Meanwhile, former W.M.U. member Lee Man-shun (Moses Chan) joins the MarsPax team and collaborates with A&E Dr Zoe So (Natalie Tong), neurosurgeon Lui Oi-ling (Kelly Cheung) and other white knights in handling all kinds of critical situations.

programme.title: Exorcist's 2nd Meter, The

He is also reunited with the mature soul of his buddy Mok Wai-ho (Hubert Wu). He even encounters Sze Loi-sze (Gloria Tang) and his younger brother Sze Lo-sze, who are both exorcists. However, some demonic curse has caused Ma Kwai to keep thinking of a doctor by the name of Chong Tsz-yeuk (Mandy Wong). Tsz-yeuk then hooks up with genie Wind Lion god (C Kwan), eventually reviving certain memory of limbo in her subconscious. Pui Pui-na (Moon Lau) has died because of Ma Kwai. She then transforms into a phantom to keep him company. But Pui-na just cannot leave everything behind as she is too sentimental about the mortal realm. A child abuse case triggers off the comeback of demonic power. Wai-ho has actually been controlled by mysterious demonic power.

But when his eldest brother, KWAN KA-HONG's business goes under, they shelve their plan to help him overcome his difficulties. KIU has to look for a job too. Unwilling to see ON shoulder the burden on his own, KWAN KA-LOK (Linda Chung), the third of the siblings, turns to her supervisor GAO WANG-CHIM (Michael Tse) for assistance, resulting in her taking part in an indecent proposal. Her boyfriend, TING KOON-FUNG (Ron Ng), breaks up angrily with her when he finds out about their affair. KWAN KA-WING (Him Law), the youngest of the four, prefers spending to saving and decides that he will in no circumstances help in the service of the mortgage. But the couple's relationship has to overcome certain hurdles. Moreover, problems keep cropping up as Ding-tin's son Cheuk-ting and his buddy Miu Shing-lam (Ricco Ng) secretly return to Hong Kong. However, some demonic curse has caused Ma Kwai to keep thinking of a doctor by the name of Chong Tsz-yeuk (Mandy Wong). Tsz-yeuk then hooks up with genie Wind Lion god (C Kwan), eventually reviving certain memory of limbo in her subconscious. Pui Pui-na (Moon Lau) has died because of Ma Kwai. She then transforms into a phantom to keep him company. But Pui-na just cannot leave everything behind as she is too sentimental about the mortal realm. A child abuse case triggers off the comeback of demonic power. Wai-ho has actually been controlled by mysterious demonic power.

Tsz-yeuk then hooks up with genie Wind Lion god (C Kwan), eventually reviving certain memory of limbo in her subconscious. Pui Pui-na (Moon Lau) has died because of Ma Kwai. Food hosts and presenters such as Icy Wong,Snowy Choi,Carmen Ngai,Carmaney Wong , Jessica Liu , Gillian Ng keep up with the latest food news and deals, delving into the stories behind the flavors. On livelihood issues, he occasionally disagrees with his father, holding different views. Ba-dou and his 40-year-old daughter, Ko Ho-yan (Tam Hoi-kei), face a significant generation gap and struggle to keep up with the ever-changing internet age. programme.desc: Wei (Zhu Jiang), the eldest son of Wei (Chen Jiewen), is wild and untamed. Under family pressure, he finally marries Shan (Zhang Fengni), with whom he has been dating for many years. After their marriage, Yat-sen develops an extramarital affair with Yan (Cui Jiabao), eventually living with her and abandoning Shan. Later, realizing Yan's overly open attitude towards relationships, he decides to pursue Shan again. Second son Zhong (Ekin Cheng), returning from abroad, brings his close girlfriend Xi (Chan Miu-ying), shattering Mei's (Chen Songling) dream of him. Shadowed by her parents' divorce, Xi eventually breaks up with Zhong. Meanwhile, Mei regains her confidence and charm. Zhong begins to admire Mei, but Mei has already joined her good friend Hao (Louis Koo). Youngest daughter Tung (Lam Chi-kwan), a bright and clever girl, marries the promising young man Tung (Wong Kai-tak). However, under her father's strict control, she dares not reveal her relationship with Tung. Can each of them fulfill their dreams and find a good home?

They're sharing these challenging times with their customers through exceptional culinary skills and delicious cuisine, a journey that brings growth to the community. Adhering to the principles of authentic, independently owned restaurants with a long history, host Christian Yang curates a selection of "Friends" restaurants, exploring the hidden, heartwarming stories behind these establishments, tasting their extraordinary signature dishes, and appreciating the fighting spirit of Hong Kong's culinary culture.

programme.desc: Farah tidak mampu lagi memaafkan Lukman apabila sekali lagi bertembung dengan Myra di dalam rumah Lukman. Seluruh kepercayaan sudah lerai. Dia keluar dari rumah dan enggan berjumpa dengan Lukman lagi. Dia sanggup tinggal di hotel demi menjauhkan diri daripada semua orang. Lukman resah apabila tidak dapat mencari Farah namun hal itu disembunyikan daripada familinya. Segalanya berpunca daripada Myra yang datang ke rumah demi mengadukan konon dirinya teraniaya. Pihak pengurusan syarikat mendapat bukti bahawa Lukman terbabit dalam kehilangan wang syarikat. Abah tidak percaya dengan tindakan Farah yang nekad ke UK meninggalkan suami dan Zahin. Budi mengesyaki ada yang tak kena dengan kes Lukman. Farah pula menanggalkan cincin perkahwinan lalu diserahkan kepada Lukman. Dia sudah redha apa sahaja jalinan takdirnya. Later, realizing Yan's overly open attitude towards relationships, he decides to pursue Shan again. Second son Zhong (Ekin Cheng), returning from abroad, brings his close girlfriend Xi (Chan Miu-ying), shattering Mei's (Chen Songling) dream of him. Shadowed by her parents' divorce, Xi eventually breaks up with Zhong. Meanwhile, Mei regains her confidence and charm. Zhong begins to admire Mei, but Mei has already joined her good friend Hao (Louis Koo). Youngest daughter Tung (Lam Chi-kwan), a bright and clever girl, marries the promising young man Tung (Wong Kai-tak). programme.desc: Hong Kong's culinary industry has been buffeted by the pandemic, economic downturn, and a surge in consumer spending in mainland China, putting its precious culinary culture at risk. Some restaurants remain steadfast, honing their craft day after day, adapting to changing circumstances. They're sharing these challenging times with their customers through exceptional culinary skills and delicious cuisine, a journey that brings growth to the community. Adhering to the principles of authentic, independently owned restaurants with a long history, host Christian Yang curates a selection of "Friends" restaurants, exploring the hidden, heartwarming stories behind these establishments, tasting their extraordinary signature dishes, and appreciating the fighting spirit of Hong Kong's culinary culture.

programme.title: Shades of Life

His eldest son, Ko Ho-pan (Wu Nuoyan), a journalism graduate and magazine editor, is a prodigy who seeks to get to the bottom of things. On livelihood issues, he occasionally disagrees with his father, holding different views. Ba-dou and his 40-year-old daughter, Ko Ho-yan (Tam Hoi-kei), face a significant generation gap and struggle to keep up with the ever-changing internet age. Fortunately, his daughter-in-law, Tung Oi-ching (Yiu Chi-ling), manages the household with impeccable organization and is a dedicated supporter of her husband and children.
